intro: Erucaria pinnata var. boissieri, commonly known as the Boissieri's erucaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its finely pinnately divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and adaptation.
